alert.note: Alert for Coastal Rockingham; Interior Rockingham; Strafford (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 4:43PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Rockingham County through 515 PM EDT... At 442 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rye, or near Exeter, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Portsmouth, Hampton, Durham, Exeter, Kittery, Greenland, Newington, Seabrook, Rye, Stratham, Newmarket, Eliot, Hampton Falls, Kensington, North Hampton, New Castle and South Hampton. This includes Interstate 95 in New Hampshire between mile markers 0 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
